intro: Phacelia purpusii, commonly known as the California phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to attract pollinators. Phacelia purpusii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local wildlife.
